Node.definition: = action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape|primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun
literally: sunset; hence: = a cardinal direction indicating the direction towards the setting of the sun
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
literally: the sea; = a cardinal direction pointing towards the west, ◄ which, in Israel, is the direction towards the Mediterranean Sea
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= area without water and therefore without vegetation and settlers; sometimes taken as the name of one specific region

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= location where a community, family, or household lives
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans are totally without physical strength and on the brink of death; ◄ caused by hunger and thirst and/or other physical suffering
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans experience distress
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= action by which deities cause humans or animals to move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
literally: straight way; = journey without accidents or incidents
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= location where a community, family, or household lives
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative process by which humans or deities cause the desire of (other) humans to be fulfilled
= a human being, as defined by the life principle that animates him/her
= state in which humans are exceedingly thirsty and long for water

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness
literally: to fill; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to find relief from their desire
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt
= causative process by which deities cause humans to have a lower estimate of their own importance, usually through punishment
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans experience distress
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability
a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a gate so that it cannot be opened from the outside
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= causative action by which a human being breaks an object into two pieces in a violent way, so that it will no longer be functional
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

Node.gloss: to be afflicted|to be bothered|to be daunted
Node.definition: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: to touch; hence: = process or action by which humans or substances arrive at a certain location
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans experience distress
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
literally: thanksgiving; hence: = a sacrifice offered as a token of thankfulness

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= boat ◄ of a relatively large size ► that is able to sail the sea or ocean

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God
= causative process by which humans, deities or forces cause an object to be of a great and more than average height
= a ridge of water curling into an arched form between two depressions in open water
= process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to fall down|to sink down|to descend
Node.definition: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
literally: (one's self) melts; hence: = process by which people are strongly affected by fear
= action by which humans move about in an unsteady way ◄ like someone who is drunk
= state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = state in which a mind event does not produce the expected outcome, as if one's senses have been destroyed
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans experience distress
literally: to bring out (of a circumstance); hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to be no longer affected by a certain circumstance
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God
= a soft, hushed sound, if any sound at all, ≈ signifying the opposite of the loud noise produced by a storm, thunder, earthquakes etc.
= action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response
= a ridge of water curling into an arched form between two depressions in open water
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= process by which stormy waters stop moving
= a place on the coast, ◄ either naturally formed or artificially created, ► where ships may moor in shelter
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which humans acknowledge the elevated status of deities and give expression to that
= people assembled together for a certain purpose

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= flowing body of water
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
literally: the going out of water; hence: = water which flows out from an underground source
= state in which land is extremely dry and in need of water, ◄ as if it were thirsty

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: fruit; hence: = products of the land, ◄ depicted as fruit; ≈ regarded as a blessing from God
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= small body of stagnant water, usually in swampy area; ≈ seen as a blessing when contrasted with the desert, but as a curse when contrasted with a developed area

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions; ≈ associated with thirst and hardship
literally: the going out of water; hence: = water which flows out from an underground source
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to make a certain place or area their home
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness
= causative action by which humans or deities bring an object into existence

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= location where a community, family, or household lives

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)

Node.gloss: to bear|to yield|to produce|to bring forth
Node.definition: literally: to make; hence: = natural process by which land, plants, or animals develop vegetation, branches, fruits, produce milk, etc.
= produce from crop bearing trees and plants

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= general term for any animal that has been domesticated; ≈ considered part of someone's wealth
= state in which humans are experiencing hardship imposed by others
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= process by which humans experience sorrow and suffering
literally: to pour out (an attitude); hence: = causative action by which deities cause something to happen to others in abundance
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
= location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
literally: to close part of one's body; hence: = to stop engaging part of one's body ► in order to stop performing a certain action
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans keep processing information in their minds
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
